New Records: Tommy Edman hit 2 home runs in the game.
Seiya Suzuki hit his 24th double of the season.
Nico Hoerner hit his 31st double of the season.
Max Muncy hit his 13th home run of the season.
Key Match Events: The Cubs scored 5 runs in the 8th inning to take the lead.
Tommy Edman hit a home run in the 2nd inning to tie the game.
Tommy Edman hit another home run in the 4th inning to give the Dodgers the lead.
Max Muncy hit a home run in the 5th inning to increase the Dodgers' lead.
The Cubs' Shota Imanaga pitched 7 strong innings to earn the win.
The Dodgers' Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched 4 strong innings to earn a no-decision.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs were looking to bounce back from a tough loss the previous day.
The Dodgers were looking to extend their lead in the division.
The Cubs' manager emphasized the importance of getting good pitching from their starters.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cubs' manager praised his team's resilience in coming back to win the game.
The Dodgers' manager was disappointed with his team's performance.
The Cubs' players were thrilled with the come-from-behind victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in front of a sell-out crowd at Dodger Stadium.
The weather was sunny and warm, with a gentle breeze blowing in from center field.
The Cubs' Seiya Suzuki extended his hitting streak to 10 games.
Others: The game was the 100th meeting between the Cubs and Dodgers.
The Cubs' Nico Hoerner reached base safely in all 4 at-bats.
